newsitem.title: POLAND: Kyungbang to invest $20 mln in Poland.
newsitem.headline: Kyungbang to invest $20 mln in Poland.

text.p: South Korea's Kyungbang concern wants to invest $20 million in Poland, mainly buying textile plants, the Gazeta Wyborcza daily said on Tuesday.

It said the Koreans were already in talks with several textile companies, notably Zaklady Tekstylno-Konfekcyjne Teofilow in the town of Lodz. No one at the Toefilow company was immediately available for comment.
Kyungbang has so far bought 84 percent of the Fonica radio firm in Lodz and pledged to invest $1.5 million in its development.
